text:
My childhood was a complex time for me. I was an extroverted, antagonistic, conscientious, neurotic, and closed to experience young girl. Growing up, I was surrounded by people who encouraged me to be creative and take risks, but I was often too scared to do so. I was the type of child who always had a plan and stuck to it, rarely veering off track. I was also very anxious and found it difficult to trust people, making it hard to make friends.

I was a hard worker, often putting in extra hours to make sure I did a good job. I was also conscientious and paid attention to detail, preferring to do things carefully and completely. I was often sad and depressed, and this made me more closed off to new experiences. Despite this, I had a good imagination and liked to think and play with ideas.

I had a good, strong personality and was usually kind and considerate to almost everyone. I wasn't very organized, and this often caused me to be careless. I was also sometimes rude to others, and this made it hard for me to make and keep friends.

When it came to artistic and creative experiences, I often stayed away from them. I was too scared to take risks and express myself in a creative way. I found it easier to stick to activities that I knew, such as reading books or playing board games. I was also shy and had a hard time talking to people, so I tended to keep to myself.

I had a lot of energy, but I was also sometimes lazy. I had trouble paying attention and often found myself daydreaming. I was also easily stressed and had a hard time staying calm in difficult situations.

I was clever and could come up with new ideas, but I often lacked the confidence to put them into action. I was creative and inventive, but I often lacked the motivation to pursue these ideas. I was also sometimes moody and could be cold and distant with others.

Overall, my childhood was a complex time for me. I was extroverted and antagonistic, but I was also very anxious and closed off to new experiences. I was a hard worker and paid attention to detail, but I was also easily stressed and could be careless. Despite this, I had a good imagination, was creative and inventive, and was usually kind and considerate to almost everyone.
prompt:

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.
